content.raw: There are still some [warnings](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/414/) on Windows. You can ignored them as I suggested [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/f5aef3ea275ecc9bb7af6991ed4c95c63b54c5e7?at=hidezmq_caguero). Not sure if there's another way of workaround it.
content.html: There are still some warnings on Windows. You can ignored them as I suggested here. Not sure if there's another way of workaround it.

content.raw:
I just made an alias for ignition-transport4 that points to the ignition-transport3 formula

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/b71af523443f0c902c1a14f7664987db29111743

That should fix CI. When we are ready for a release or if dependencies change, then we can make a separate formula, but aliases help reduce duplicate code.
content.html:
I just made an alias for ignition-transport4 that points to the ignition-transport3 formula

  • https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/b71af523443f0c902c1a14f7664987db29111743

That should fix CI. When we are ready for a release or if dependencies change, then we can make a separate formula, but aliases help reduce duplicate code.

content.raw: In fact, you can cherry-pick [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/commits/f5aef3ea275ecc9bb7af6991ed4c95c63b54c5e7?at=hidezmq_caguero) commit. I have verified that doesn't have any warnings [on Windows](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/412/).
content.html: In fact, you can cherry-pick this commit. I have verified that doesn't have any warnings on Windows.

content.raw: For the record, we agreed on a combination of the last option when possible and the creation of the private header under `.cc` when you really need it in a separate file. We can leave `NodeSharedPrivate.hh` as it is in this pull request and move the other private headers in a separate pull request.
content.html: For the record, we agreed on a combination of the last option when possible and the creation of the private header under .cc when you really need it in a separate file. We can leave NodeSharedPrivate.hh as it is in this pull request and move the other private headers in a separate pull request.

content.raw: Can we keep version 3.x.x for now? CI breaks in OSX if we bump to 4. We can work on the Hombrew formula meanwhile.
content.html: Can we keep version 3.x.x for now? CI breaks in OSX if we bump to 4. We can work on the Hombrew formula meanwhile.

content.raw:
This should avoid some Windows and style warnings.

```
#!c++

#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(push, 0)
#endif
#include <zmq.hpp>
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(pop)
#endif

#include <vector>
```
content.html:
This should avoid some Windows and style warnings.

#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(push, 0)
#endif
#include <zmq.hpp>
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(pop)
#endif

#include <vector>

content.raw:
I see your point but it might be a bit confusing because there are other private headers that are not installed in `include/ignition/transport`. I would propose:

* Move `NodeSharedPrivate.hh` to `include/ignition/transport` as it is to maintain consistency.
* Move all the private headers to a new directory `include/ignition/transport/private` to make it more evident (probably in a separate pull request).
* Remove all `*Private.hh` files and include its content in the `.cc` files (probably in a separate pull request).

Does it sound reasonable?
content.html:
I see your point but it might be a bit confusing because there are other private headers that are not installed in include/ignition/transport. I would propose:

  • Move NodeSharedPrivate.hh to include/ignition/transport as it is to maintain consistency.
  • Move all the private headers to a new directory include/ignition/transport/private to make it more evident (probably in a separate pull request).
  • Remove all *Private.hh files and include its content in the .cc files (probably in a separate pull request).

Does it sound reasonable?

content.raw: Thanks. I merged this, but I left `NodeSharedPrivate` in the `src` directory as an indication that this header is private/local/not-installed.
content.html: Thanks. I merged this, but I left NodeSharedPrivate in the src directory as an indication that this header is private/local/not-installed.

content.raw: I made a few tweaks in [this branch](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/branch/hidezmq_caguero?dest=hidezmq#diff). Feel free to merge if reasonable.
content.html: I made a few tweaks in this branch. Feel free to merge if reasonable.

content.raw: This PR will allow us to easily switch ZMQ versions in the future.
content.html: This PR will allow us to easily switch ZMQ versions in the future.
